meanings.definition: To remove or destroy the roots of (something)
meanings.sent1: The storm outrooted the old tree in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully outrooted the weeds from the flower bed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel outrooted all the newly planted flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The invasive vines outrooted the native plants, taking over the entire forest.
meanings.sent5: The strong winds outrooted the firmly planted fence posts, scattering them across the yard.

meanings.sent1: The medicine outrooted the virus from the patient's body.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard to outroot the corruption from the organization.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission was to outroot all evil from the city.
meanings.sent4: The detective was determined to outroot the criminal organization plaguing the town.
meanings.sent5: The new technology outrooted the need for outdated manual processes, streamlining the workflow.

meanings.definition: To uproot or displace from a place or position
meanings.sent1: The flood outrooted many families from their homes.
meanings.sent2: The construction project outrooted the community park.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's antics threatened to outroot the peace in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The sudden job transfer outrooted the employee from their familiar work environment.
meanings.sent5: The war outrooted entire populations, forcing them to seek refuge in neighboring countries.
